acceptGrowCapacityPoolForShortTermCloneS.title: acceptGrowCapacityPoolForShortTermCloneSplit
acceptGrowCapacityPoolForShortTermCloneS.description: While auto splitting the short term clone volume, if the parent pool does not have enough space to accommodate the volume after split, it will be automatically resized, which will lead to increased billing. To accept capacity pool size auto grow and create a short term clone volume, set the property as accepted.

values.description: Auto grow capacity pool for short term clone split is accepted.
Auto grow capacity pool for short term clone split is declined. Short term clone volume creation will not be allowed, to create short term clone volume accept auto grow capacity pool.

snapshotDirectoryVisible.description: If enabled (true) the volume will contain a read-only snapshot directory which provides access to each of the volume's snapshots (defaults to true).

kerberosEnabled.description: Describe if a volume is KerberosEnabled. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later

securityStyle.description: The security style of volume, default unix, defaults to ntfs for dual protocol or CIFS protocol

smbEncryption.description: Enables encryption for in-flight smb3 data. Only applicable for SMB/DualProtocol volume. To be used with swagger version 2020-08-01 or later

smbAccessBasedEnumeration.title: smbAccessBasedEnumeration
smbAccessBasedEnumeration.description: Enables access-based enumeration share property for SMB Shares. Only applicable for SMB/DualProtocol volume

smbNonBrowsable.title: smbNonBrowsable
smbNonBrowsable.description: Enables non-browsable property for SMB Shares. Only applicable for SMB/DualProtocol volume

smbContinuouslyAvailable.description: Enables continuously available share property for smb volume. Only applicable for SMB volume

throughputMibps.title: Maximum throughput in MiB/s that can be achieved by this volume and this will be accepted as input only for manual qosType volume

actualThroughputMibps.description: Actual throughput in MiB/s for auto qosType volumes calculated based on size and serviceLevel

encryptionKeySource.description: Source of key used to encrypt data in volume. Applicable if NetApp account has encryption.keySource = 'Microsoft.KeyVault'. Possible values (case-insensitive) are: 'Microsoft.NetApp, Microsoft.KeyVault'

keyVaultPrivateEndpointResourceId.description: The resource ID of private endpoint for KeyVault. It must reside in the same VNET as the volume. Only applicable if encryptionKeySource = 'Microsoft.KeyVault'.

ldapEnabled.description: Specifies whether LDAP is enabled or not for a given NFS volume.

coolAccess.description: Specifies whether Cool Access(tiering) is enabled for the volume.

coolnessPeriod.description: Specifies the number of days after which data that is not accessed by clients will be tiered.

coolAccessRetrievalPolicy.description:
coolAccessRetrievalPolicy determines the data retrieval behavior from the cool tier to standard storage based on the read pattern for cool access enabled volumes. The possible values for this field are: 
 Default - Data will be pulled from cool tier to standard storage on random reads. This policy is the default.
 OnRead - All client-driven data read is pulled from cool tier to standard storage on both sequential and random reads.
 Never - No client-driven data is pulled from cool tier to standard storage.

coolAccessTieringPolicy.description: coolAccessTieringPolicy determines which cold data blocks are moved to cool tier. The possible values for this field are: Auto - Moves cold user data blocks in both the Snapshot copies and the active file system to the cool tier tier. This policy is the default. SnapshotOnly - Moves user data blocks of the Volume Snapshot copies that are not associated with the active file system to the cool tier.

unixPermissions.description: UNIX permissions for NFS volume accepted in octal 4 digit format. First digit selects the set user ID(4), set group ID (2) and sticky (1) attributes. Second digit selects permission for the owner of the file: read (4), write (2) and execute (1). Third selects permissions for other users in the same group. the fourth for other users not in the group. 0755 - gives read/write/execute permissions to owner and read/execute to group and other users.

cloneProgress.description: When a volume is being restored from another volume's snapshot, will show the percentage completion of this cloning process. When this value is empty/null there is no cloning process currently happening on this volume. This value will update every 5 minutes during cloning.

fileAccessLogs.description: Flag indicating whether file access logs are enabled for the volume, based on active diagnostic settings present on the volume.

avsDataStore.title: avsDataStore
avsDataStore.description: Specifies whether the volume is enabled for Azure VMware Solution (AVS) datastore purpose

isDefaultQuotaEnabled.description: Specifies if default quota is enabled for the volume.

defaultUserQuotaInKiBs.description: Default user quota for volume in KiBs. If isDefaultQuotaEnabled is set, the minimum value of 4 KiBs applies .

defaultGroupQuotaInKiBs.description: Default group quota for volume in KiBs. If isDefaultQuotaEnabled is set, the minimum value of 4 KiBs applies.

maximumNumberOfFiles.description: Maximum number of files allowed. Needs a service request in order to be changed. Only allowed to be changed if volume quota is more than 4TiB.

capacityPoolResourceId.description: Pool Resource Id used in case of creating a volume through volume group

proximityPlacementGroup.description: Proximity placement group associated with the volume

volumeSpecName.description: Volume spec name is the application specific designation or identifier for the particular volume in a volume group for e.g. data, log

encrypted.description: Specifies if the volume is encrypted or not. Only available on volumes created or updated after 2022-01-01.

usageThreshold.title: usageThreshold
usageThreshold.description: Maximum storage quota allowed for a file system in bytes. This is a soft quota used for alerting only. For regular volumes, valid values are in the range 50GiB to 100TiB. For large volumes, valid values are in the range 100TiB to 500TiB, and on an exceptional basis, from to 2400GiB to 2400TiB. Values expressed in bytes as multiples of 1 GiB.

defaultUserQuotaInKiBs.description: Default user quota for volume in KiBs. If isDefaultQuotaEnabled is set, the minimum value of 4 KiBs applies .

defaultGroupQuotaInKiBs.description: Default group quota for volume in KiBs. If isDefaultQuotaEnabled is set, the minimum value of 4 KiBs applies.

maximumNumberOfFiles.description: Maximum number of files allowed. Needs a service request in order to be changed. Only allowed to be changed if volume quota is more than 4TiB.

capacityPoolResourceId.description: Pool Resource Id used in case of creating a volume through volume group

proximityPlacementGroup.description: Proximity placement group associated with the volume

volumeSpecName.description: Volume spec name is the application specific designation or identifier for the particular volume in a volume group for e.g. data, log

encrypted.description: Specifies if the volume is encrypted or not. Only available on volumes created or updated after 2022-01-01.

placementRules.title: Volume placement rules
placementRules.description: Application specific placement rules for the particular volume

items.description: Application specific parameters for the placement of volumes in the volume group

key.description: Key for an application specific parameter for the placement of volumes in the volume group

value.description: Value for an application specific parameter for the placement of volumes in the volume group

enableSubvolumes.description: Flag indicating whether subvolume operations are enabled on the volume

provisionedAvailabilityZone.title: Provisioned Availability Zone
provisionedAvailabilityZone.description: The availability zone where the volume is provisioned. This refers to the logical availability zone where the volume resides.

isLargeVolume.title: Is Large Volume
isLargeVolume.description: Specifies whether volume is a Large Volume or Regular Volume.

originatingResourceId.title: Originating Resource Id
originatingResourceId.description: Id of the snapshot or backup that the volume is restored from.

inheritedSizeInBytes.title: inheritedSizeInBytes
inheritedSizeInBytes.description: Space shared by short term clone volume with parent volume in bytes.

delete.description: Delete the specified volume group only if there are no volumes under volume group.

CheckAvailabilityResponse.description: Information regarding availability of a resource.

isAvailable.description: true indicates name is valid and available. false indicates the name is invalid, unavailable, or both.

reason.description: Invalid indicates the name provided does not match Azure App Service naming requirements. AlreadyExists indicates that the name is already in use and is therefore unavailable.

message.description: If reason == invalid, provide the user with the reason why the given name is invalid, and provide the resource naming requirements so that the user can select a valid name. If reason == AlreadyExists, explain that resource name is already in use, and direct them to select a different name.

Active Directory in use by SMB Volume

statusDetails.description: Any details in regards to the Status of the Active Directory

smbServerName.description: NetBIOS name of the SMB server. This name will be registered as a computer account in the AD and used to mount volumes

organizationalUnit.description: The Organizational Unit (OU) within the Windows Active Directory

site.description: The Active Directory site the service will limit Domain Controller discovery to

backupOperators.description: Users to be added to the Built-in Backup Operator active directory group. A list of unique usernames without domain specifier

administrators.description: Users to be added to the Built-in Administrators active directory group. A list of unique usernames without domain specifier

kdcIP.description: kdc server IP address for the active directory machine. This optional parameter is used only while creating kerberos volume.

adName.description: Name of the active directory machine. This optional parameter is used only while creating kerberos volume

serverRootCACertificate.description: When LDAP over SSL/TLS is enabled, the LDAP client is required to have base64 encoded Active Directory Certificate Service's self-signed root CA certificate, this optional parameter is used only for dual protocol with LDAP user-mapping volumes.

aesEncryption.description: If enabled, AES encryption will be enabled for SMB communication.

ldapSigning.description: Specifies whether or not the LDAP traffic needs to be signed.

securityOperators.description: Domain Users in the Active directory to be given SeSecurityPrivilege privilege (Needed for SMB Continuously available shares for SQL). A list of unique usernames without domain specifier

ldapOverTLS.description: Specifies whether or not the LDAP traffic needs to be secured via TLS.

allowLocalNfsUsersWithLdap.description: If enabled, NFS client local users can also (in addition to LDAP users) access the NFS volumes.

encryptDCConnections.description: If enabled, Traffic between the SMB server to Domain Controller (DC) will be encrypted.

userDN.description: This specifies the user DN, which overrides the base DN for user lookups.

groupDN.description: This specifies the group DN, which overrides the base DN for group lookups.

groupMembershipFilter.description: This specifies the custom LDAP search filter to be used when looking up group membership from LDAP server.

preferredServersForLdapClient.description: Comma separated list of IPv4 addresses of preferred servers for LDAP client. At most two comma separated IPv4 addresses can be passed.

keySource.description: The encryption keySource (provider). Possible values (case-insensitive):  Microsoft.NetApp, Microsoft.KeyVault

keyVaultProperties.description: Properties provided by KeVault. Applicable if keySource is 'Microsoft.KeyVault'.

keyVaultId.description: UUID v4 used to identify the Azure Key Vault configuration

values.description: KeyVault connection created but not in use
KeyVault connection in use by SMB Volume

identity.description: Identity used to authenticate to KeyVault. Applicable if keySource is 'Microsoft.KeyVault'.

principalId.description: The principal ID (object ID) of the identity used to authenticate with key vault. Read-only.

userAssignedIdentity.description: The ARM resource identifier of the user assigned identity used to authenticate with key vault. Applicable if identity.type has 'UserAssigned'. It should match key of identity.userAssignedIdentities.

federatedClientId.description: ClientId of the multi-tenant AAD Application. Used to access cross-tenant keyvaults.

disableShowmount.description: Shows the status of disableShowmount for all volumes under the subscription, null equals false

nfsV4IDDomain.description: Domain for NFSv4 user ID mapping. This property will be set for all NetApp accounts in the subscription and region and only affect non ldap NFSv4 volumes.

values.description: Account is MultiAD disabled, Means its a SharedAD or SingleAD account.

serverRootCACertificate.description: When LDAP over SSL/TLS is enabled, the LDAP client is required to have base64 encoded Active Directory Certificate Service's self-signed root CA certificate, this optional parameter is used only for dual protocol with LDAP user-mapping volumes.

aesEncryption.description: If enabled, AES encryption will be enabled for SMB communication.

ldapSigning.description: Specifies whether or not the LDAP traffic needs to be signed.

securityOperators.description: Domain Users in the Active directory to be given SeSecurityPrivilege privilege (Needed for SMB Continuously available shares for SQL). A list of unique usernames without domain specifier

ldapOverTLS.description: Specifies whether or not the LDAP traffic needs to be secured via TLS.

allowLocalNfsUsersWithLdap.description: If enabled, NFS client local users can also (in addition to LDAP users) access the NFS volumes.

encryptDCConnections.description: If enabled, Traffic between the SMB server to Domain Controller (DC) will be encrypted.

userDN.description: This specifies the user DN, which overrides the base DN for user lookups.

groupDN.description: This specifies the group DN, which overrides the base DN for group lookups.

groupMembershipFilter.description: This specifies the custom LDAP search filter to be used when looking up group membership from LDAP server.

preferredServersForLdapClient.description: Comma separated list of IPv4 addresses of preferred servers for LDAP client. At most two comma separated IPv4 addresses can be passed.

keySource.description: The encryption keySource (provider). Possible values (case-insensitive):  Microsoft.NetApp, Microsoft.KeyVault

keyVaultProperties.description: Properties provided by KeVault. Applicable if keySource is 'Microsoft.KeyVault'.

keyVaultId.description: UUID v4 used to identify the Azure Key Vault configuration

values.description: KeyVault connection created but not in use

federatedClientId.description: ClientId of the multi-tenant AAD Application. Used to access cross-tenant keyvaults.

disableShowmount.description: Shows the status of disableShowmount for all volumes under the subscription, null equals false

nfsV4IDDomain.description: Domain for NFSv4 user ID mapping. This property will be set for all NetApp accounts in the subscription and region and only affect non ldap NFSv4 volumes.

values.description: Account is MultiAD disabled, Means its a SharedAD or SingleAD account.

id.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the resource. E.g. "/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}"

poolId.title: poolId
poolId.description: UUID v4 used to identify the Pool

size.title: size
size.description: Provisioned size of the pool (in bytes). Allowed values are in 1TiB chunks (value must be multiple of 1099511627776).

serviceLevel.title: serviceLevel
serviceLevel.description: The service level of the file system

values.description: Zone redundant storage service level. This will be deprecated soon.

totalThroughputMibps.description: Total throughput of pool in MiB/s

utilizedThroughputMibps.description: Utilized throughput of pool in MiB/s

customThroughputMibps.title: Maximum throughput in MiB/s that can be achieved by this pool and this will be accepted as input only for manual qosType pool with Flexible service level

qosType.title: qosType
qosType.description: The qos type of the pool

coolAccess.description: If enabled (true) the pool can contain cool Access enabled volumes.

encryptionType.title: encryptionType
encryptionType.description: Encryption type of the capacity pool, set encryption type for data at rest for this pool and all volumes in it. This value can only be set when creating new pool.

values.description: EncryptionType Single, volumes will use single encryption at rest
EncryptionType Double, volumes will use double encryption at rest

fileSystemId.title: FileSystem ID
fileSystemId.description: Unique FileSystem Identifier.

creationToken.title: Creation Token or File Path
creationToken.description: A unique file path for the volume. Used when creating mount targets

serviceLevel.title: serviceLevel
serviceLevel.description: The service level of the file system

values.description: Zone redundant storage service level. This will be deprecated soon.

usageThreshold.title: usageThreshold
usageThreshold.description: Maximum storage quota allowed for a file system in bytes. This is a soft quota used for alerting only. For regular volumes, valid values are in the range 50GiB to 100TiB. For large volumes, valid values are in the range 100TiB to 500TiB, and on an exceptional basis, from to 2400GiB to 2400TiB. Values expressed in bytes as multiples of 1 GiB.

kerberos5ReadOnly.description: Kerberos5 Read only access. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later

kerberos5ReadWrite.description: Kerberos5 Read and write access. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later

kerberos5iReadOnly.description: Kerberos5i Read only access. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later

kerberos5iReadWrite.description: Kerberos5i Read and write access. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later

kerberos5pReadOnly.description: Kerberos5p Read only access. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later

kerberos5pReadWrite.description: Kerberos5p Read and write access. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later

nfsv3.description: Allows NFSv3 protocol. Enable only for NFSv3 type volumes

nfsv41.description: Allows NFSv4.1 protocol. Enable only for NFSv4.1 type volumes

allowedClients.description: Client ingress specification as comma separated string with IPv4 CIDRs, IPv4 host addresses and host names

chownMode.description: This parameter specifies who is authorized to change the ownership of a file. restricted - Only root user can change the ownership of the file. unrestricted - Non-root users can change ownership of files that they own.

protocolTypes.title: protocolTypes
protocolTypes.description: Set of protocol types, default NFSv3, CIFS for SMB protocol

snapshotId.title: Snapshot ID
snapshotId.description: Resource identifier used to identify the Snapshot.

deleteBaseSnapshot.description: If enabled (true) the snapshot the volume was created from will be automatically deleted after the volume create operation has finished.  Defaults to false

backupId.title: Backup ID
backupId.description: Resource identifier used to identify the Backup.

subnetId.description: The Azure Resource URI for a delegated subnet. Must have the delegation Microsoft.NetApp/volumes

networkFeatures.title: Network features
networkFeatures.description: Network features available to the volume, or current state of update.

values.description: Updating from Basic to Standard network features.
Updating from Standard to Basic network features.

effectiveNetworkFeatures.title: Network features
effectiveNetworkFeatures.description: Network features available to the volume, or current state of update.

values.description: Updating from Basic to Standard network features.
Updating from Standard to Basic network features.

networkSiblingSetId.title: Network Sibling Set ID
networkSiblingSetId.description: Network Sibling Set ID for the the group of volumes sharing networking resources.

storageToNetworkProximity.title: Storage to Network Proximity
storageToNetworkProximity.description: Provides storage to network proximity information for the volume.

values.description: Standard T1 storage to network connectivity.
Standard T2 storage to network connectivity.
Standard AcrossT2 storage to network connectivity.

mountTargetId.title: mountTargetId
mountTargetId.description: UUID v4 used to identify the MountTarget

fileSystemId.title: fileSystemId
fileSystemId.description: UUID v4 used to identify the MountTarget

smbServerFqdn.title: smbServerFQDN
smbServerFqdn.description: The SMB server's Fully Qualified Domain Name, FQDN

volumeType.description: What type of volume is this. For destination volumes in Cross Region Replication, set type to DataProtection. For creating clone volume, set type to ShortTermClone

dataProtection.title: DataProtection
dataProtection.description: DataProtection type volumes include an object containing details of the replication

endpointType.description: Indicates whether the local volume is the source or destination for the Volume Replication

remoteVolumeResourceId.description: The resource ID of the remote volume. Required for cross region and cross zone replication

remotePath.description: The full path to a volume that is to be migrated into ANF. Required for Migration volumes

externalHostName.description: The Path to a ONTAP Host

serverName.description: The name of a server on the ONTAP Host

volumeName.description: The name of a volume on the server

remoteVolumeRegion.description: The remote region for the other end of the Volume Replication.

resourceId.description: The resource ID of the remote volume

replicationType.description: Indicates whether the replication is cross zone or cross region.

region.description: The remote region for the destination volume.

zone.description: The remote zone for the destination volume.

relocationRequested.description: Has relocation been requested for this volume

readyToBeFinalized.description: Has relocation finished and is ready to be cleaned up

acceptGrowCapacityPoolForShortTermCloneS.title: acceptGrowCapacityPoolForShortTermCloneSplit
acceptGrowCapacityPoolForShortTermCloneS.description: While auto splitting the short term clone volume, if the parent pool does not have enough space to accommodate the volume after split, it will be automatically resized, which will lead to increased billing. To accept capacity pool size auto grow and create a short term clone volume, set the property as accepted.

values.description: Auto grow capacity pool for short term clone split is accepted.
Auto grow capacity pool for short term clone split is declined. Short term clone volume creation will not be allowed, to create short term clone volume accept auto grow capacity pool.

snapshotDirectoryVisible.description: If enabled (true) the volume will contain a read-only snapshot directory which provides access to each of the volume's snapshots (defaults to true).

kerberosEnabled.description: Describe if a volume is KerberosEnabled. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later

securityStyle.description: The security style of volume, default unix, defaults to ntfs for dual protocol or CIFS protocol

smbEncryption.description: Enables encryption for in-flight smb3 data. Only applicable for SMB/DualProtocol volume. To be used with swagger version 2020-08-01 or later

smbAccessBasedEnumeration.title: smbAccessBasedEnumeration
smbAccessBasedEnumeration.description: Enables access-based enumeration share property for SMB Shares. Only applicable for SMB/DualProtocol volume

smbNonBrowsable.title: smbNonBrowsable
smbNonBrowsable.description: Enables non-browsable property for SMB Shares. Only applicable for SMB/DualProtocol volume

smbContinuouslyAvailable.description: Enables continuously available share property for smb volume. Only applicable for SMB volume

throughputMibps.title: Maximum throughput in MiB/s that can be achieved by this volume and this will be accepted as input only for manual qosType volume

actualThroughputMibps.description: Actual throughput in MiB/s for auto qosType volumes calculated based on size and serviceLevel

encryptionKeySource.description: Source of key used to encrypt data in volume. Applicable if NetApp account has encryption.keySource = 'Microsoft.KeyVault'. Possible values (case-insensitive) are: 'Microsoft.NetApp, Microsoft.KeyVault'

keyVaultPrivateEndpointResourceId.description: The resource ID of private endpoint for KeyVault. It must reside in the same VNET as the volume. Only applicable if encryptionKeySource = 'Microsoft.KeyVault'.

ldapEnabled.description: Specifies whether LDAP is enabled or not for a given NFS volume.

coolAccess.description: Specifies whether Cool Access(tiering) is enabled for the volume.

coolnessPeriod.description: Specifies the number of days after which data that is not accessed by clients will be tiered.

coolAccessRetrievalPolicy.description:
coolAccessRetrievalPolicy determines the data retrieval behavior from the cool tier to standard storage based on the read pattern for cool access enabled volumes. The possible values for this field are: 
 Default - Data will be pulled from cool tier to standard storage on random reads. This policy is the default.
 OnRead - All client-driven data read is pulled from cool tier to standard storage on both sequential and random reads.
 Never - No client-driven data is pulled from cool tier to standard storage.

coolAccessTieringPolicy.description: coolAccessTieringPolicy determines which cold data blocks are moved to cool tier. The possible values for this field are: Auto - Moves cold user data blocks in both the Snapshot copies and the active file system to the cool tier tier. This policy is the default. SnapshotOnly - Moves user data blocks of the Volume Snapshot copies that are not associated with the active file system to the cool tier.

unixPermissions.description: UNIX permissions for NFS volume accepted in octal 4 digit format. First digit selects the set user ID(4), set group ID (2) and sticky (1) attributes. Second digit selects permission for the owner of the file: read (4), write (2) and execute (1). Third selects permissions for other users in the same group. the fourth for other users not in the group. 0755 - gives read/write/execute permissions to owner and read/execute to group and other users.

cloneProgress.description: When a volume is being restored from another volume's snapshot, will show the percentage completion of this cloning process. When this value is empty/null there is no cloning process currently happening on this volume. This value will update every 5 minutes during cloning.

fileAccessLogs.description: Flag indicating whether file access logs are enabled for the volume, based on active diagnostic settings present on the volume.

avsDataStore.title: avsDataStore
avsDataStore.description: Specifies whether the volume is enabled for Azure VMware Solution (AVS) datastore purpose

isDefaultQuotaEnabled.description: Specifies if default quota is enabled for the volume.

defaultUserQuotaInKiBs.description: Default user quota for volume in KiBs. If isDefaultQuotaEnabled is set, the minimum value of 4 KiBs applies .

defaultGroupQuotaInKiBs.description: Default group quota for volume in KiBs. If isDefaultQuotaEnabled is set, the minimum value of 4 KiBs applies.

maximumNumberOfFiles.description: Maximum number of files allowed. Needs a service request in order to be changed. Only allowed to be changed if volume quota is more than 4TiB.

capacityPoolResourceId.description: Pool Resource Id used in case of creating a volume through volume group

proximityPlacementGroup.description: Proximity placement group associated with the volume

volumeSpecName.description: Volume spec name is the application specific designation or identifier for the particular volume in a volume group for e.g. data, log

encrypted.description: Specifies if the volume is encrypted or not. Only available on volumes created or updated after 2022-01-01.

placementRules.title: Volume placement rules
placementRules.description: Application specific placement rules for the particular volume

items.description: Application specific parameters for the placement of volumes in the volume group

key.description: Key for an application specific parameter for the placement of volumes in the volume group

value.description: Value for an application specific parameter for the placement of volumes in the volume group

enableSubvolumes.description: Flag indicating whether subvolume operations are enabled on the volume

provisionedAvailabilityZone.title: Provisioned Availability Zone
provisionedAvailabilityZone.description: The availability zone where the volume is provisioned. This refers to the logical availability zone where the volume resides.

isLargeVolume.title: Is Large Volume
isLargeVolume.description: Specifies whether volume is a Large Volume or Regular Volume.

originatingResourceId.title: Originating Resource Id
originatingResourceId.description: Id of the snapshot or backup that the volume is restored from.

inheritedSizeInBytes.title: inheritedSizeInBytes
inheritedSizeInBytes.description: Space shared by short term clone volume with parent volume in bytes.

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of results.

values.description: Zone redundant storage service level. This will be deprecated soon.

usageThreshold.title: usageThreshold
usageThreshold.description: Maximum storage quota allowed for a file system in bytes. This is a soft quota used for alerting only. For regular volumes, valid values are in the range 50GiB to 100TiB. For large volumes, valid values are in the range 100TiB to 500TiB, and on an exceptional basis, from to 2400GiB to 2400TiB. Values expressed in bytes as multiples of 1 GiB.

acceptGrowCapacityPoolForShortTermCloneS.title: acceptGrowCapacityPoolForShortTermCloneSplit
acceptGrowCapacityPoolForShortTermCloneS.description: While auto splitting the short term clone volume, if the parent pool does not have enough space to accommodate the volume after split, it will be automatically resized, which will lead to increased billing. To accept capacity pool size auto grow and create a short term clone volume, set the property as accepted.

values.description: Auto grow capacity pool for short term clone split is accepted.
Auto grow capacity pool for short term clone split is declined. Short term clone volume creation will not be allowed, to create short term clone volume accept auto grow capacity pool.

snapshotDirectoryVisible.description: If enabled (true) the volume will contain a read-only snapshot directory which provides access to each of the volume's snapshots (defaults to true).

kerberosEnabled.description: Describe if a volume is KerberosEnabled. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later

securityStyle.description: The security style of volume, default unix, defaults to ntfs for dual protocol or CIFS protocol

smbEncryption.description: Enables encryption for in-flight smb3 data. Only applicable for SMB/DualProtocol volume. To be used with swagger version 2020-08-01 or later

smbAccessBasedEnumeration.title: smbAccessBasedEnumeration
smbAccessBasedEnumeration.description: Enables access-based enumeration share property for SMB Shares. Only applicable for SMB/DualProtocol volume

smbNonBrowsable.title: smbNonBrowsable
smbNonBrowsable.description: Enables non-browsable property for SMB Shares. Only applicable for SMB/DualProtocol volume

smbContinuouslyAvailable.description: Enables continuously available share property for smb volume. Only applicable for SMB volume

throughputMibps.title: Maximum throughput in MiB/s that can be achieved by this volume and this will be accepted as input only for manual qosType volume

actualThroughputMibps.description: Actual throughput in MiB/s for auto qosType volumes calculated based on size and serviceLevel

encryptionKeySource.description: Source of key used to encrypt data in volume. Applicable if NetApp account has encryption.keySource = 'Microsoft.KeyVault'. Possible values (case-insensitive) are: 'Microsoft.NetApp, Microsoft.KeyVault'

keyVaultPrivateEndpointResourceId.description: The resource ID of private endpoint for KeyVault. It must reside in the same VNET as the volume. Only applicable if encryptionKeySource = 'Microsoft.KeyVault'.

ldapEnabled.description: Specifies whether LDAP is enabled or not for a given NFS volume.

coolAccess.description: Specifies whether Cool Access(tiering) is enabled for the volume.

coolnessPeriod.description: Specifies the number of days after which data that is not accessed by clients will be tiered.

coolAccessRetrievalPolicy.description:
coolAccessRetrievalPolicy determines the data retrieval behavior from the cool tier to standard storage based on the read pattern for cool access enabled volumes. The possible values for this field are: 
 Default - Data will be pulled from cool tier to standard storage on random reads. This policy is the default.
 OnRead - All client-driven data read is pulled from cool tier to standard storage on both sequential and random reads.
 Never - No client-driven data is pulled from cool tier to standard storage.

coolAccessTieringPolicy.description: coolAccessTieringPolicy determines which cold data blocks are moved to cool tier. The possible values for this field are: Auto - Moves cold user data blocks in both the Snapshot copies and the active file system to the cool tier tier. This policy is the default. SnapshotOnly - Moves user data blocks of the Volume Snapshot copies that are not associated with the active file system to the cool tier.

unixPermissions.description: UNIX permissions for NFS volume accepted in octal 4 digit format. First digit selects the set user ID(4), set group ID (2) and sticky (1) attributes. Second digit selects permission for the owner of the file: read (4), write (2) and execute (1). Third selects permissions for other users in the same group. the fourth for other users not in the group. 0755 - gives read/write/execute permissions to owner and read/execute to group and other users.

cloneProgress.description: When a volume is being restored from another volume's snapshot, will show the percentage completion of this cloning process. When this value is empty/null there is no cloning process currently happening on this volume. This value will update every 5 minutes during cloning.

fileAccessLogs.description: Flag indicating whether file access logs are enabled for the volume, based on active diagnostic settings present on the volume.

avsDataStore.title: avsDataStore
avsDataStore.description: Specifies whether the volume is enabled for Azure VMware Solution (AVS) datastore purpose

isDefaultQuotaEnabled.description: Specifies if default quota is enabled for the volume.

defaultUserQuotaInKiBs.description: Default user quota for volume in KiBs. If isDefaultQuotaEnabled is set, the minimum value of 4 KiBs applies .

defaultGroupQuotaInKiBs.description: Default group quota for volume in KiBs. If isDefaultQuotaEnabled is set, the minimum value of 4 KiBs applies.

maximumNumberOfFiles.description: Maximum number of files allowed. Needs a service request in order to be changed. Only allowed to be changed if volume quota is more than 4TiB.

capacityPoolResourceId.description: Pool Resource Id used in case of creating a volume through volume group

proximityPlacementGroup.description: Proximity placement group associated with the volume

volumeSpecName.description: Volume spec name is the application specific designation or identifier for the particular volume in a volume group for e.g. data, log

encrypted.description: Specifies if the volume is encrypted or not. Only available on volumes created or updated after 2022-01-01.

placementRules.description: Application specific placement rules for the particular volume

provisionedAvailabilityZone.description: The availability zone where the volume is provisioned. This refers to the logical availability zone where the volume resides.

 Default - Data will be pulled from cool tier to standard storage on random reads. This policy is the default.
 OnRead - All client-driven data read is pulled from cool tier to standard storage on both sequential and random reads.
 Never - No client-driven data is pulled from cool tier to standard storage.

coolAccessTieringPolicy.description: coolAccessTieringPolicy determines which cold data blocks are moved to cool tier. The possible values for this field are: Auto - Moves cold user data blocks in both the Snapshot copies and the active file system to the cool tier tier. This policy is the default. SnapshotOnly - Moves user data blocks of the Volume Snapshot copies that are not associated with the active file system to the cool tier.

snapshotDirectoryVisible.description: If enabled (true) the volume will contain a read-only snapshot directory which provides access to each of the volume's snapshots.

smbAccessBasedEnumeration.title: smbAccessBasedEnumeration
smbAccessBasedEnumeration.description: Enables access-based enumeration share property for SMB Shares. Only applicable for SMB/DualProtocol volume

smbNonBrowsable.title: smbNonBrowsable
smbNonBrowsable.description: Enables non-browsable property for SMB Shares. Only applicable for SMB/DualProtocol volume

serviceLevel.title: serviceLevel
serviceLevel.description: The service level of the file system

values.description: Zone redundant storage service level. This will be deprecated soon.

usageThreshold.title: usageThreshold
usageThreshold.description: Maximum storage quota allowed for a file system in bytes. This is a soft quota used for alerting only. For regular volumes, valid values are in the range 50GiB to 100TiB. For large volumes, valid values are in the range 100TiB to 500TiB, and on an exceptional basis, from to 2400GiB to 2400TiB. Values expressed in bytes as multiples of 1 GiB.

kerberos5ReadWrite.description: Kerberos5 Read and write access. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later

kerberos5iReadWrite.description: Kerberos5i Read and write access. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later

kerberos5pReadWrite.description: Kerberos5p Read and write access. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later

nfsv3.description: Allows NFSv3 protocol. Enable only for NFSv3 type volumes

nfsv41.description: Allows NFSv4.1 protocol. Enable only for NFSv4.1 type volumes

allowedClients.description: Client ingress specification as comma separated string with IPv4 CIDRs, IPv4 host addresses and host names

chownMode.description: This parameter specifies who is authorized to change the ownership of a file. restricted - Only root user can change the ownership of the file. unrestricted - Non-root users can change ownership of files that they own.

protocolTypes.title: protocolTypes
protocolTypes.description: Set of protocol types, default NFSv3, CIFS for SMB protocol

throughputMibps.title: Maximum throughput in MiB/s that can be achieved by this volume and this will be accepted as input only for manual qosType volume

dataProtection.title: DataProtection
dataProtection.description: DataProtection type volumes include an object containing details of the replication

isDefaultQuotaEnabled.description: Specifies if default quota is enabled for the volume.

defaultUserQuotaInKiBs.description: Default user quota for volume in KiBs. If isDefaultQuotaEnabled is set, the minimum value of 4 KiBs applies .

defaultGroupQuotaInKiBs.description: Default group quota for volume in KiBs. If isDefaultQuotaEnabled is set, the minimum value of 4 KiBs applies.

unixPermissions.description: UNIX permissions for NFS volume accepted in octal 4 digit format. First digit selects the set user ID(4), set group ID (2) and sticky (1) attributes. Second digit selects permission for the owner of the file: read (4), write (2) and execute (1). Third selects permissions for other users in the same group. the fourth for other users not in the group. 0755 - gives read/write/execute permissions to owner and read/execute to group and other users.

coolnessPeriod.description: Specifies the number of days after which data that is not accessed by clients will be tiered.

acceptGrowCapacityPoolForShortTermCloneS.title: acceptGrowCapacityPoolForShortTermCloneSplit
acceptGrowCapacityPoolForShortTermCloneS.description: While auto splitting the short term clone volume, if the parent pool does not have enough space to accommodate the volume after split, it will be automatically resized, which will lead to increased billing. To accept capacity pool size auto grow and create a short term clone volume, set the property as accepted.

values.description: Auto grow capacity pool for short term clone split is accepted.
Auto grow capacity pool for short term clone split is declined. Short term clone volume creation will not be allowed, to create short term clone volume accept auto grow capacity pool.

acceptGrowCapacityPoolForShortTermCloneS.title: acceptGrowCapacityPoolForShortTermCloneSplit
acceptGrowCapacityPoolForShortTermCloneS.description: While auto splitting the short term clone volume, if the parent pool does not have enough space to accommodate the volume after split, it will be automatically resized, which will lead to increased billing. To accept capacity pool size auto grow and create a short term clone volume, set the property as accepted.

values.description: Auto grow capacity pool for short term clone split is accepted.
Auto grow capacity pool for short term clone split is declined. Short term clone volume creation will not be allowed, to create short term clone volume accept auto grow capacity pool.

snapshotDirectoryVisible.description: If enabled (true) the volume will contain a read-only snapshot directory which provides access to each of the volume's snapshots (defaults to true).

kerberosEnabled.description: Describe if a volume is KerberosEnabled. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later

securityStyle.description: The security style of volume, default unix, defaults to ntfs for dual protocol or CIFS protocol

smbEncryption.description: Enables encryption for in-flight smb3 data. Only applicable for SMB/DualProtocol volume. To be used with swagger version 2020-08-01 or later

smbAccessBasedEnumeration.title: smbAccessBasedEnumeration
smbAccessBasedEnumeration.description: Enables access-based enumeration share property for SMB Shares. Only applicable for SMB/DualProtocol volume

smbNonBrowsable.title: smbNonBrowsable
smbNonBrowsable.description: Enables non-browsable property for SMB Shares. Only applicable for SMB/DualProtocol volume

smbContinuouslyAvailable.description: Enables continuously available share property for smb volume. Only applicable for SMB volume

throughputMibps.title: Maximum throughput in MiB/s that can be achieved by this volume and this will be accepted as input only for manual qosType volume

actualThroughputMibps.description: Actual throughput in MiB/s for auto qosType volumes calculated based on size and serviceLevel

encryptionKeySource.description: Source of key used to encrypt data in volume. Applicable if NetApp account has encryption.keySource = 'Microsoft.KeyVault'. Possible values (case-insensitive) are: 'Microsoft.NetApp, Microsoft.KeyVault'

keyVaultPrivateEndpointResourceId.description: The resource ID of private endpoint for KeyVault. It must reside in the same VNET as the volume. Only applicable if encryptionKeySource = 'Microsoft.KeyVault'.

ldapEnabled.description: Specifies whether LDAP is enabled or not for a given NFS volume.

coolAccess.description: Specifies whether Cool Access(tiering) is enabled for the volume.

coolnessPeriod.description: Specifies the number of days after which data that is not accessed by clients will be tiered.

coolAccessRetrievalPolicy.description:
coolAccessRetrievalPolicy determines the data retrieval behavior from the cool tier to standard storage based on the read pattern for cool access enabled volumes. The possible values for this field are: 
 Default - Data will be pulled from cool tier to standard storage on random reads. This policy is the default.
 OnRead - All client-driven data read is pulled from cool tier to standard storage on both sequential and random reads.
 Never - No client-driven data is pulled from cool tier to standard storage.

coolAccessTieringPolicy.description: coolAccessTieringPolicy determines which cold data blocks are moved to cool tier. The possible values for this field are: Auto - Moves cold user data blocks in both the Snapshot copies and the active file system to the cool tier tier. This policy is the default. SnapshotOnly - Moves user data blocks of the Volume Snapshot copies that are not associated with the active file system to the cool tier.

unixPermissions.description: UNIX permissions for NFS volume accepted in octal 4 digit format. First digit selects the set user ID(4), set group ID (2) and sticky (1) attributes. Second digit selects permission for the owner of the file: read (4), write (2) and execute (1). Third selects permissions for other users in the same group. the fourth for other users not in the group. 0755 - gives read/write/execute permissions to owner and read/execute to group and other users.

cloneProgress.description: When a volume is being restored from another volume's snapshot, will show the percentage completion of this cloning process. When this value is empty/null there is no cloning process currently happening on this volume. This value will update every 5 minutes during cloning.

fileAccessLogs.description: Flag indicating whether file access logs are enabled for the volume, based on active diagnostic settings present on the volume.

avsDataStore.title: avsDataStore
avsDataStore.description: Specifies whether the volume is enabled for Azure VMware Solution (AVS) datastore purpose

isDefaultQuotaEnabled.description: Specifies if default quota is enabled for the volume.

defaultUserQuotaInKiBs.description: Default user quota for volume in KiBs. If isDefaultQuotaEnabled is set, the minimum value of 4 KiBs applies .

defaultGroupQuotaInKiBs.description: Default group quota for volume in KiBs. If isDefaultQuotaEnabled is set, the minimum value of 4 KiBs applies.

maximumNumberOfFiles.description: Maximum number of files allowed. Needs a service request in order to be changed. Only allowed to be changed if volume quota is more than 4TiB.

capacityPoolResourceId.description: Pool Resource Id used in case of creating a volume through volume group

proximityPlacementGroup.description: Proximity placement group associated with the volume

volumeSpecName.description: Volume spec name is the application specific designation or identifier for the particular volume in a volume group for e.g. data, log

encrypted.description: Specifies if the volume is encrypted or not. Only available on volumes created or updated after 2022-01-01.

provisionedAvailabilityZone.description: The availability zone where the volume is provisioned. This refers to the logical availability zone where the volume resides.

coolAccessRetrievalPolicy.description:
coolAccessRetrievalPolicy determines the data retrieval behavior from the cool tier to standard storage based on the read pattern for cool access enabled volumes. The possible values for this field are: 
 Default - Data will be pulled from cool tier to standard storage on random reads. This policy is the default.
 OnRead - All client-driven data read is pulled from cool tier to standard storage on both sequential and random reads.

SnapshotOnly - Moves user data blocks of the Volume Snapshot copies that are not associated with the active file system to the cool tier.

usageThreshold.title: usageThreshold
usageThreshold.description: Maximum storage quota allowed for a file system in bytes. This is a soft quota used for alerting only. For regular volumes, valid values are in the range 50GiB to 100TiB. For large volumes, valid values are in the range 100TiB to 500TiB, and on an exceptional basis, from to 2400GiB to 2400TiB. Values expressed in bytes as multiples of 1 GiB.

kerberos5ReadOnly.description: Kerberos5 Read only access. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later

chownMode.description: This parameter specifies who is authorized to change the ownership of a file. restricted - Only root user can change the ownership of the file. unrestricted - Non-root users can change ownership of files that they own.

protocolTypes.description: Set of protocol types, default NFSv3, CIFS for SMB protocol

relocationRequested.description: Has relocation been requested for this volume

readyToBeFinalized.description: Has relocation finished and is ready to be cleaned up

acceptGrowCapacityPoolForShortTermCloneS.title: acceptGrowCapacityPoolForShortTermCloneSplit
acceptGrowCapacityPoolForShortTermCloneS.description: While auto splitting the short term clone volume, if the parent pool does not have enough space to accommodate the volume after split, it will be automatically resized, which will lead to increased billing. To accept capacity pool size auto grow and create a short term clone volume, set the property as accepted.

values.description: Auto grow capacity pool for short term clone split is accepted.
Auto grow capacity pool for short term clone split is declined. Short term clone volume creation will not be allowed, to create short term clone volume accept auto grow capacity pool.

snapshotDirectoryVisible.description: If enabled (true) the volume will contain a read-only snapshot directory which provides access to each of the volume's snapshots (defaults to true).

kerberosEnabled.description: Describe if a volume is KerberosEnabled. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later

securityStyle.description: The security style of volume, default unix, defaults to ntfs for dual protocol or CIFS protocol

smbEncryption.description: Enables encryption for in-flight smb3 data. Only applicable for SMB/DualProtocol volume. To be used with swagger version 2020-08-01 or later

smbAccessBasedEnumeration.title: smbAccessBasedEnumeration
smbAccessBasedEnumeration.description: Enables access-based enumeration share property for SMB Shares. Only applicable for SMB/DualProtocol volume

smbNonBrowsable.title: smbNonBrowsable
smbNonBrowsable.description: Enables non-browsable property for SMB Shares. Only applicable for SMB/DualProtocol volume

smbContinuouslyAvailable.description: Enables continuously available share property for smb volume. Only applicable for SMB volume

throughputMibps.title: Maximum throughput in MiB/s that can be achieved by this volume and this will be accepted as input only for manual qosType volume

actualThroughputMibps.description: Actual throughput in MiB/s for auto qosType volumes calculated based on size and serviceLevel

encryptionKeySource.description: Source of key used to encrypt data in volume. Applicable if NetApp account has encryption.keySource = 'Microsoft.KeyVault'. Possible values (case-insensitive) are: 'Microsoft.NetApp, Microsoft.KeyVault'

keyVaultPrivateEndpointResourceId.description: The resource ID of private endpoint for KeyVault. It must reside in the same VNET as the volume. Only applicable if encryptionKeySource = 'Microsoft.KeyVault'.

ldapEnabled.description: Specifies whether LDAP is enabled or not for a given NFS volume.

coolAccess.description: Specifies whether Cool Access(tiering) is enabled for the volume.

coolnessPeriod.description: Specifies the number of days after which data that is not accessed by clients will be tiered.

coolAccessRetrievalPolicy.description:
coolAccessRetrievalPolicy determines the data retrieval behavior from the cool tier to standard storage based on the read pattern for cool access enabled volumes. The possible values for this field are: 
 Default - Data will be pulled from cool tier to standard storage on random reads. This policy is the default.
 OnRead - All client-driven data read is pulled from cool tier to standard storage on both sequential and random reads.
 Never - No client-driven data is pulled from cool tier to standard storage.

coolAccessTieringPolicy.description: coolAccessTieringPolicy determines which cold data blocks are moved to cool tier. The possible values for this field are: Auto - Moves cold user data blocks in both the Snapshot copies and the active file system to the cool tier tier. This policy is the default. SnapshotOnly - Moves user data blocks of the Volume Snapshot copies that are not associated with the active file system to the cool tier.

unixPermissions.description: UNIX permissions for NFS volume accepted in octal 4 digit format. First digit selects the set user ID(4), set group ID (2) and sticky (1) attributes. Second digit selects permission for the owner of the file: read (4), write (2) and execute (1). Third selects permissions for other users in the same group. the fourth for other users not in the group. 0755 - gives read/write/execute permissions to owner and read/execute to group and other users.

cloneProgress.description: When a volume is being restored from another volume's snapshot, will show the percentage completion of this cloning process. When this value is empty/null there is no cloning process currently happening on this volume. This value will update every 5 minutes during cloning.

fileAccessLogs.description: Flag indicating whether file access logs are enabled for the volume, based on active diagnostic settings present on the volume.

avsDataStore.title: avsDataStore
avsDataStore.description: Specifies whether the volume is enabled for Azure VMware Solution (AVS) datastore purpose

isDefaultQuotaEnabled.description: Specifies if default quota is enabled for the volume.

defaultUserQuotaInKiBs.description: Default user quota for volume in KiBs. If isDefaultQuotaEnabled is set, the minimum value of 4 KiBs applies .

defaultGroupQuotaInKiBs.description: Default group quota for volume in KiBs. If isDefaultQuotaEnabled is set, the minimum value of 4 KiBs applies.

maximumNumberOfFiles.description: Maximum number of files allowed. Needs a service request in order to be changed. Only allowed to be changed if volume quota is more than 4TiB.

capacityPoolResourceId.description: Pool Resource Id used in case of creating a volume through volume group

proximityPlacementGroup.description: Proximity placement group associated with the volume

volumeSpecName.description: Volume spec name is the application specific designation or identifier for the particular volume in a volume group for e.g. data, log

encrypted.description: Specifies if the volume is encrypted or not. Only available on volumes created or updated after 2022-01-01.

 Default - Data will be pulled from cool tier to standard storage on random reads. This policy is the default.

 Never - No client-driven data is pulled from cool tier to standard storage.

coolAccessTieringPolicy.description: coolAccessTieringPolicy determines which cold data blocks are moved to cool tier. SnapshotOnly - Moves user data blocks of the Volume Snapshot copies that are not associated with the active file system to the cool tier.
